IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 RC2 is out.
A fresh IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 RC is out.
A fresh IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 EAP is out.
A fresh IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 Public Preview build is out.

The IntelliJ IDEA 2016.2.5 update is available.
Apart from bugfixes, the update brings support for macOS Sierra.

Welcome IntelliJ IDEA 2016.2, a second update planned for this year.
The update brings lots of new features and improvements across the
built-in tools, UI, and support for languages and frameworks.

Learn more about the update by reading the blog post.
IntelliJ IDEA 2016.1.4 build 145.2070 is available with important bugfixes.
IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 RC2 is out.
IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 RC is now available.

IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 is now available for a public preview.

Notable new features include:

  • Java: Refactoring to Java 8, Inspections with no-highlighting policy
  • JVM Debugger: Class-level watches, Memory view
  • Code Editor: Parameter hints, Semantic highlighting
  • Build Tools: Delegate IDE build/run actions to Gradle, Gradle composite
    builds, Polyglot maven
  • VCS Improvements: Git/Mercurial Log, Merge and Diff, Managing remotes
  • JavaScript Improvements: ECMAScript 6, TypeScript, Flow
  • Android: Blueprint, Constraint Layout, more stable Instant Run,
    APK Analyzer
  • Databases: Editing multiple cells, Bulk submit

For more details and screenshots, read the blog post.

The IntelliJ IDEA 2016.2.5 update is available.

RubyMine 2016.2.5 is out.

This update fixes the sensitive scrolling problem in macOS Sierra. Check out the release notes for the full list of changes.

RubyMine 2016.3 BETA is Now Available!

Major changes since 2016.2:

  • Attach with debugger to local ruby process
  • Faster gem downloading
  • Better Puppet support
  • New gem management UI
  • Support for Rails Mailers
  • Improved VCS
  • JavaScript improvements

Please check out our "What’s new" page to find more about new features.

RubyMine 2016.3 BETA is Now Available!

Major changes since 2016.2:

  • Attach with debugger to local ruby process
  • Faster gem downloading
  • Better Puppet support
  • New gem management UI
  • Support for Rails Mailers
  • Improved VCS
  • JavaScript improvements

Please check out our "What’s new" page to find more about new features.

In this update we've switched to a more modern API of the Python Package Index repository.

For more details please read this blog post.

PyCharm 2016.1.5 is now available.

In this update we've switched to a more modern API of the Python Package Index repository.

For more details please read this blog post.

The new PyCharm 2016.2 is out.

Some of the features are:

  • vmprof Profiler support
  • Pandas dataframes viewer
  • Thread suspend option
  • Function return values in the debugger
  • Configuration for optimize imports
  • Lettuce scenario outlines
  • Support for ligatures
  • Custom background image for the editor
  • Enhanced VCS log viewer

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.2.3 bug-fix update is out.

For more details please read the blog post.

The new PyCharm 2016.3 EAP is now open!

Some of the features are:

  • Support for PEP 526: Syntax for variable annotations
  • Support for PEP 498: Formatted string literals
  • Support for PEP 515: Underscores in numeric literals
  • Type checking of the inferred type of a function against the type specified in the type hint
  • Tab code completion in IPython console

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 EAP 2 (build 163.5644.6) is available.

Some of the features are:

  • Support for PEP 525: Asynchronous generators
  • Support for PEP 530: Asynchronous comprehensions
  • Various bug fixes

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 EAP 3 (build 163.6110.26) is available.

Some of the features are:

  • Code completion for Django forms in class-based views
  • Better handling of multi-line commands in Python console
  • Improvements in Python 3.6 support
  • Various bug fixes

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 EAP 4 (build 163.6512.5) is available.

Some of the features are:

  • Simplified variables view for Variables Pane
  • Various bug fixes

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 Public Preview (build 163.6957.22) is available.

Some of the features are:

  • Django projects Run/Debug on a remote machine
  • Python 3.6: Intention action for converting comment-based type hints to variable annotations
  • Python 3.6: Intention action for converting str.format() and percent-style formatting into f-string literals
  • Code insight for function type hints in comments
  • Support for the new syntax for TEMPLATES (Django)
  • "View as..." hyperlink in the variables explorer
  • Docker Compose: overrides for configuration files
  • Docker Compose: environment variables in Compose files
  • Branch coverage support
  • Line profiling support with vmprof
  • Virtualenv auto activation in terminal

For the full features list of the Public Preview please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 Public Preview 2 (build 163.7342.4) is available.

This build contains fixes to the Python console, debugger, inspections, and the Docker integration.

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 Public Preview 3 (build 163.7743.16) is available.

This build contains Jupyter Notebook improvements and other bug fixes.

You can see all the new features since 2016.2 and try out the new version on the preview page.

For more details please read the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 RC (build 163.8233.4) is available.

We are approaching the release of 2016's third major PyCharm update.

Since the previous public preview we've fixed several bugs, see details in the blog post.

PyCharm 2016.3 Public Preview 3 (build 163.7743.16) is available.

The new minor release of our professional PHP IDE with various improvements and bug fixes, is now available for download!

This release brings new bugfixes and usability improvements:

- Completion of function parameter is disabled by default
- A critical fix addressing a startup crash on OS X 10.10
Other changes from IntelliJ platform and web are also included.

The new minor release of our professional PHP IDE with various bug fixes, is now available for download!

This release brings new features, bugfixes and usability improvements:

- Fixed scrolling on macOS Sierra

Other changes from IntelliJ platform and web are also included.

This build is a preview of PhpStorm 2016.3. This public preview build brings new features,
bugfixes and usability improvements:


Tools and Frameworks:
- Support of Docker in Remote Interpreters
ё - PHPSpec support
- Auto-detection and configuration of PHPUnit, Behat, PHPSpec

PHP Language & Editing Experience :
- Semantic highlighting for variables and parameters
- Completion of overriden methods and fields
- Improved support of PSR-0/PSR-4

Code Quality Analysis:
- Project wide PHP 7 strict types
- New naming convention inspections
- Improved Runtime Error Prevention

Many other features and changes from IntelliJ platform and web are also included.

This build is a first release candidate of PhpStorm 2016.3.
This RC1 build brings features, bugfixes and usability improvements:

- Support of class_alias
- Blade: Support hasSection directive
Many other features and changes from IntelliJ platform and web are also included. See Release Notes.

This build is a second release candidate of PhpStorm 2016.3.
This RC2 build brings platform bugfixes and usability improvements.

See Release Notes.

Please meet WebStorm 2016.3, the third big WebStorm update of 2016!

Visit What’s new in WebStorm to see a full overview of new features added in WebStorm 2016.3
and learn about the great progress WebStorm made in earlier 2016 releases.

Download WebStorm for a free 30-day trial today. If you decide to keep using WebStorm 2016.3,
purchase a subscription at jetbrains.com as an existing customer and get a 40% automatic discount
before January 1, 2017.

WebStorm 11.0.4, a security update, is now available.

IMPORTANT: This free update contains important security fixes and is strongly recommended for all users.
For more details please read this blog post.

Meet WebStorm 2016.3, the third big WebStorm update of 2016!

Visit What’s new in WebStorm 2016.3 for a full list of new features and an overview video.

And here’re the highlights:

  • Support for Flow: type errors are reported right in the editor; Flow-powered code completion
  • Support for React Native: code completion; running and debugging apps in WebStorm
  • Better TypeScript support: more precise code completion and analysis; smarter Rename refactoring
    that understands the inheritance hierarchy
  • Set of inspections and quick-fixes for migrating the code to ES6 and a new Convert to class intention
  • Integration with Stylelint; support for PostCSS via a plugin; running and debugging tests with Protractor;
    quick bootstrap to run and debug Node.js app in Docker; better support for ES6 destructuring, and even more!

WebStorm 2016.3 beta is now available!

In this update we added a new Convert to class intention for JavaScript objects and support for Yarn.

A full list of new features coming in WebStorm 2016.3 is now available on the website.

WebStorm 2016.2.4 is now available!

This update brings over 30 bug fixes and improvements, including fixes for scrolling on macOS Sierra and better Unicode support in the find dialogs

For a full list of addressed issues please read the Release notes.

WebStorm 2016.1.3 is now available!

This update brings various bug fixes and improvements, including support for Angular 2 RC and npm scoped packages.

Meet WebStorm 2016.3, the third big WebStorm update of 2016!

Visit What’s new in WebStorm 2016.3 for a full list of new features and an overview video.

And here’re the highlights:

  • Support for Flow: type errors are reported right in the editor; Flow-powered code completion
  • Support for React Native: code completion; running and debugging apps in WebStorm
  • Better TypeScript support: more precise code completion and analysis; smarter Rename refactoring
    that understands the inheritance hierarchy
  • Set of inspections and quick-fixes for migrating the code to ES6 and a new Convert to class intention
  • Integration with Stylelint; support for PostCSS via a plugin; running and debugging tests with Protractor;
    quick bootstrap to run and debug Node.js app in Docker; better support for ES6 destructuring, and even more!

WebStorm 2016.2.2, a new bug fix update for WebStorm 2016.2, is now available!

This update brings various bug fixes and performance improvements.

For a more detailed overview please read this blog post.

WebStorm 2016.2.1, the first bug fix update for WebStorm 2016.2, is now available!

This update brings over 80 bug fixes and improvements, including:

  • New state diagram for AngularJS apps that use ui-router
  • Fixes for debugging Karma tests from the IDE
  • New sorting in JavaScript code completion results – recently used options are now shown first

For a more detailed overview please read this blog post.

In DataGrip 1.0.5 we've fixed the problem with information about the perpetual fallback license.
In DataGrip 2016.1.2 we've fixed the problem with information about the perpetual fallback license.

DataGrip 2016.2.6 is released.

  • Fixed problem with sensitive scrolling on macOS Sierra

DataGrip 2016.3 new EAP build

  • Data conversion
  • Materialized views support in PostgreSQL
  • Drop triggers from UI
  • Faster scripts execution
  • New icons

To learn more, see the blog post.
